article_title: Take a Number: Nobody Wins Games Like Kirk Nieuwenhuis
article_text:
By almost any measure, Mets outfielder Kirk Nieuwenhuis is a fringe major-league baseball player: This season, he has been sent down to Triple-A and called back up a total of six times, and in the majority of the 51 big-league games he's played in 2014, he has served as a pinch hitter or defensive replacement. His .261 batting average is by far his career high.

But maybe the Mets, who entered Wednesday night's game against Colorado at 70-75, should consider penciling Nieuwenhuis into the lineup card more often: They are a...
